byline.contributor: Chris Buckley contributed reporting from Beijing. Ailin Tang contributed research.

abstract: China is scrambling to mine and burn more coal, responding to diminishing stockpiles and fears of electricity blackouts, even as it assumes leading role in fight against climate change; response to coal scarcity points to difficulty of weaning country off coal and of meeting worldwide emissions targets; Chinese coal is world’s largest single source of carbon emissions from human activities.
lead_paragraph: China is reopening mines amid worries about power supplies, demonstrating how difficult it will be to wean its giant economy from coal dependence.

headline.main: Despite Climate Change Vow, China Pushes to Dig More Coal
